snippet: The Amsterdam-based telecommunications operator said it would pay $795 million to resolve American and Dutch investigations into a bribery scheme in Uzbekistan
abstract: Amsterdam-based telecommunications firm VimpelCom will pay $795 million after company pleads guilty in Manhattan federal court to bribing Uzbekistan officials.
lead_paragraph: The Amsterdam-based telecommunications operator said it would pay $795 million to resolve American and Dutch investigations into a bribery scheme in Uzbekistan

headline.print_headline: Vimpel Com Pays $795 Million to Settle Bribery Inquiries
headline.main: VimpelCom Pays $795 Million to Settle Bribery Inquiries
